channel.title: Fixing the "..." option on custom items ground options!

item.title: Fixing the "..." option on custom items ground options!
item.dc:creator: @alexahnon alexahnon
item.description:
@alexahnon wrote:

MakeusoreRS:

What does this do?

It removes the “…” option when item is on ground after adding custom items over an specific item ID. (Only in some clients)
Thanks a lot, was looking for this for a while.

Read full topic

No problem, I’ve seen a lot of clients that didn’t have this fixed, so I hope this helps people :)[br][br][size=1]Posted on: December 03, 2009, 09:22:20 pm[/size][hr][quote=“SilentCJ, post:2, topic:317392”]Thanks for this, I had this fixed ages ago, but I’ve seen a lot of people ask it since then, so yeah. :)[/quote]

SilentCJ, you should add this to your tutorial about adding items to your client

item.source: Fixing the "..." option on custom items ground options!

item.title: Fixing the "..." option on custom items ground options!
item.dc:creator: @Tonic Tonic
item.description:
@Tonic wrote:

[quote=“Teh Moose, post:1, topic:317392”]Ok, well first of all this is actually really easy.

Open up class8 and find

class8.method203(true, aClass30_Sub2_Sub2_183);

right underneath that put this in if you use nonrenamed

if (i > 7955) { class8.aStringArray168 = null; }

If you use renamed put this in Itemdef.java

if (i > 7955) { itemDef.groundActions = null; }[/quote]

Will be using this, Thanks rep+

Read full topic
item.source: Fixing the "..." option on custom items ground options!

item.title: Fixing the "..." option on custom items ground options!
item.dc:creator: @Teh_Moose Teh Moose
item.description:
@Teh_Moose wrote:

Ok, well first of all this is actually really easy.

Open up class8 and find

class8.method203(true, aClass30_Sub2_Sub2_183);

right underneath that put this in if you use nonrenamed

if (i > 7955) { class8.aStringArray168 = null; }

If you use renamed put this in Itemdef.java

if (i > 7955) { itemDef.groundActions = null; }

Read full topic
